title: Progressive and Non-progressive Uses of Verbs

questions.question: I ....................... fine.
questions.description: The word feel can be used in continuous and non-continuous forms to talk about health.

questions.question: I ........................ you shouldn't do this.
questions.description: When feel means 'have an opinion', it is not used in the continuous form.

questions.question: What ..................... you ..................... about my hair style?
questions.description: When think means 'have an opinion' it doesn't have an ing form.

questions.question: I ............................. your dad tomorrow.
questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about an arrangement that already exists.

questions.question: The fish ......................... awful.
questions.description: Verbs that refer to the use of the senses do not normally have continuous forms.

questions.question: I ......................... this song.
questions.description: The verbs love and like are almost never used in the continuous form.

questions.question: I rang her up because I ........................... to talk.
questions.description: The verb want is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: I ....................... what you mean.
questions.description: When 'see' means understand it is not used in the continuous form.

questions.question: The stew ............................ wonderful.
questions.description: The verb 'taste' is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: If I ....................... the answer, I will tell you.
questions.description: The verb 'know' is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: He ............................ 85 kg.
questions.description: The verb 'weigh' is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: ..................... you .................... in God?
questions.description: The verb 'believe' does not normally have a continuous form.
